summary:
My job experience and expertise focuses on the boundary between Development and Operations. In previous functions I have been in either one of these organisations, which is why I feel very much at home in a DevOps team, where SCRUM and Agile are more than buzzwords.
I get my job satisfaction from thinking up and carrying out solutions for technical challenges, always seeking to find the smartest and most efficient solution. If needed, I can specify the solution in a detailed way, enabling someone else to implement or develop it.

In my current position I facilitate DevOps teams by providing, operating and innovating for them:
• a CI/CD pipeline
• a standardised, version-controlled deployment method, in which configuration-as-code is an important pillar

I think of myself as a real team player and feel most comfortable in a team. Outside office hours I also support my fellow team members. I am a great proponent of sharing knowledge and information.
My work attitude is typified by the following statements:
• ‘Yes it is possible – Every technical challenge can be overcome, it is a question of time and means.
• ‘How difficult can it be?’ – Knowledge and skills gained in ICT can often easily be transferred to a new challenge. One who is familiar with OO programming will be quickly up to steam when starting with Java. I have not come across anything I have not been able to learn.

projects.description:
As part of a much larger project for an operator in Australia, the customisation deliverables for which I was responsible were:
•	Secure File Pusher
Developed in Perl, this customisation serves to automate the transfer of large volumes of files to one or more remote server using an encrypted protocol (SSH). The focus was on redundancy, reliability, security and ease of support.
•	Prepaid Subscriber Provisioner
Developed by a third party, this customisation serves to process changes to the subscriptions of prepaid mobile users into the database(s). Being developed by a third party, this customisation demanded extra attention to the establishment of clear and concise requirements and high-level design.
•	TAS Provisioner
Developed by a third party, this customisation serves to process changes to the specific number mappings that enable the employer to make traffic routing decisions and track traffic distribution for which revenue can be claimed at other operators. Being developed by a third party, this customisation demanded extra attention to the establishment of clear and concise requirements and high-level design.

projects.title: Broadband EIR in Norway
projects.description: Assembled from existing Acision products (Flexible Gateway and Directory Server), with internal logic developed in Pascal and provisioning of Directory Server in Perl, this customised Solution serves to authorize or block access to the LTE network of a Norwegian mobile operator for mobile equipment that has been marked 'stolen' or 'lost' by a national law-enforcement authority (Norwegian Police). The focus was on accuracy, reliability and performance.

profile_positions.description:
Summary: As a Solution Engineer I was a part of the Global Customisation Services team that made sure that the Acision core products integrated into the customer’s environment. Core tasks included: analysis of the requirements, bid-support, packaging work to be performed internally or externally, project management for the customisation, implementation of the customisation in the customer environment, integration testing and support.

Role:
A Solution Engineer provides customised software solutions that enhance standard product offerings to meet customer requirements. This includes developing the solution independently or through leading a development team.
The Solution Engineer participates in the full sales, project and support lifecycle to ensure appropriate revenue and quality, while taking leadership and ownership for team activities.

Key Accountabilities:
- Undertake the review and assessment of change requests on existing customisations or requests for new customisations in terms of suitability of such requests and the effort estimation of software creation and implementation.
- Lead and own full software lifecycle activities for accepted requests from the requirements analysis through to development and testing as well as the publication of all required deliverables such as software and technical manuals to established quality standards.
- Lead and own deployment activities for customer-specific requests including the creation of documentation tailored to the target environment through to actual implementation activities as required and to agreed schedules.
- Undertake full support lifecycle activities for implemented requests including code and documentation maintenance to required customer-satisfaction and service levels.
- Be a point of contact amongst peers for expertise and coaching.
- Recommend process improvements for the development and management of customisations.
- Lead and own documentation reviews.
